website_summaries.verdict: The 2013 Kindle Fire HD works perfectly as an e-reader with a few extra tablet features, but users looking to take full advantage of Amazon's ecosystem should pay more for the Fire HDX.
pros: The Amazon Kindle Fire HD (2013) is faster than its predecessors, has an affordable price, and runs the latest and greatest version of the Kindle Fire OS
cons: Its default storage size -- 8GB -- is too little space for most tablet needs
Also, there are no cameras and Amazon's video chat customer support is not available
Ad removal still costs an extra $15

website_summaries.verdict: The first easy-to-use, affordable small-screen tablet, the Amazon Kindle Fire is revolutionary.
pros: Free cloud storage for Amazon content

customer_reviews.title: It's SOooooooo Old now LOL
customer_reviews.text: LOL it's so old now. It is now 2020 I bought this in 2013. I wish Amazon made their kindles like this still. I love the carousel. My Battery lasts for days not hours and it doesn't glitch out. It is a little long in the tooth in tech years. So it is slow to download a book. But I can close it and it doesn't kill my book losing my spot or being unable to pull it back up. My 2019 Kindle 7 inch glitches out looses places in my book its battery wont last a full day with out charge. I hate the layout of the new kindles and how they mimic a run of the mill tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the Kindle
customer_reviews.text: Preferred the original version which had the “next page” & “previous page” buttons but overall a great purchase, once again, of a Kindle. Probably my 4th or 5th now & I wouldn’t be without one. Very small & light for traveling or my handbag, without losing any screen quality. Love the screen as I have big problems with blue light, even with light-blocking screens, glasses etc. I’ve tried the lot - I still have major problems. Of course, I have NONE of these problems with the Kindle & can read all day & all night if I choose to. Love it! Highly recommend & will definitely keep on buying as long as they have their special paper-like screen. A+++
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: 7 years, still running great!
customer_reviews.text: I love my kindle. I am an avid reader, and although I have a newer version, I prefer using this one...It just feels better in my hands. This device has been dropped to the floor over and over again (I fall asleep reading every night) and continues to work the same as new. And I love the parental controls that allow children to safely use one. I have played games on it, but I have so many books now, this kindle is dedicated for just reading. Thanks for making my day.
customer_reviews.author: dotti1022

customer_reviews.title: Appealing Performance
customer_reviews.text: The kindle is a reliable e-reader and the text is clear and can be easily magnified. The internet connectivity is impressive for streaming movies and the battery's charge is sufficient for multi-tasking with social media. The applications can be arranged according to the user's preferences and the storage is decent for photographs of family activities. The High Definition display is also of superior quality because I have not detected any pixelated graphics for 4K videos. The WiFi connectivity favors speed and does not attenuate even when the user is located approximately 150 meters from the router and the wireless setup was a simple process. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Luckicharm

customer_reviews.title: OMG this thing was so frustrating to use. It ...
customer_reviews.text: OMG this thing was so frustrating to use. It took forever to come on and then it would take forever to load apps or even to click on another webpage. I used it maybe 12 times total until I ended up just putting it in the drawer because it was just so damn slow and frustrating to use.
customer_reviews.author: Markus Antonio

customer_reviews.title: We paid for a product that would last a long ...
customer_reviews.text: We paid for a product that would last a long time, we got a product that wasn't designed to last at all. In fat, it was intentionally designed to become obsolete. If by chance it is still working after 4 years, you will get an error msg asking for a system password. There is no system password. The most that Amazon tech support will do is offer a newer one for 15% off.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Hanke

customer_reviews.title: Like our other Kindles
customer_reviews.text: Like our other Kindles, this one worked fine while it worked, but it died at just past the 1 year mark. This is our 4th Kindle that has expired before reaching its second birthday. None have been dropped, they just stop working. Apple iPads are much more expensive, but we've yet to have one die on us, so unless Amazon starts giving Kindles away, we won't be buying anything but Apple products (and maybe Samsung).
customer_reviews.author: Greg Azimov

customer_reviews.title: So Happy With My Kindle!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. I. Love. My. Kindle. So many free and fun apps to choose from, easy and instant gratification to read books, and watching videos with my prime account! The color is good, it's not too heavy but still sturdy enough to feel solid, the sound quality is great, the shipping flawless. Amazon really hit the ball out of the park with this. I don't even like using other tablets because the UI is so poor compared to Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: My favorite so far
customer_reviews.text: When my previous-generation Kindle Fire HD was stolen, I bought this to replace it. I considered a larger screen, but the portability of this model made me choose it. The screen is bright and battery life is good. The built-in web browser means that it will do most things any Android tablet will do, while sill having the superior reading experience of a genuine Kindle. I bought the somewhat-quirky "Origami" case for it. See my separate review, but I recommend some kind of case to protect the screen when not in use. As always, the "Special Offers" never intrude when you're doing something with the Kindle, and some of them do offer intriguing items tailored to your habits. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas Gift.
customer_reviews.text: Everyone told me not to get a Kindle. Go for an iPad they said! I didn't have enough money to spend on an iPad, and I actually really wanted the kindle for all of the book deals. It streams Netflix and HBO perfectly and can easily be watched with headphones on while I run on the elliptical. It does run slow sometimes and occasionally glitches, but overall I am really happy with this purchase. It was a great Christmas gift to myself.
customer_reviews.author: The Cold One

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware: Google problems with kindle fire before you purchase. Currently I have several kindle 's but only one working charger .Also reset to factory defaults too often because color goes green. I obviously like my kindle, easy to use. Special offers don't bother me due to the number of free apps available.But if you Google problems with kindle fire. You will find; find top 11, top twenty and top thirty.My current frustration is , I have a box of chargers and cords that won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Cherl Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Do Items Like This Normally Last 2 Months?
customer_reviews.text: I got this product in November of 2013, and by January of 2014 I had to send it back because it would not turn on (naturally inhibiting the purposeful usage thereof). All I have to say is that I will NOT be getting one in the near future, or possibly ever. This is the first product by them with which I have had problems. Maybe it was a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Watchman

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: basically worthless after a year even if u just use it as a reading device cant add memory gets bloated with amazon useless software, amazon app store just awful no variety and no way to jail break device to make it some what use able just get an iPad with kindle app or talk to some knowledgeable techies to help you
customer_reviews.author: Silent

customer_reviews.title: A sort of low-cost I-pad
customer_reviews.text: We now have three Kindles, including the original model. I bought two for my wife, but I finally got one for myself. I don't use it a lot because I don't read books all that often, but it is handy for accessing the internet, particularly in places where I don't want to lug around a laptop. This does some of the same stuff that a smartphone does, but without the high annual cost. You've got to be careful when browsing Amazon products though. You can end up ordering stuff by accident when you are just trying to find out what the price is. It is not the same as shopping Amazon with a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: R. Roten

customer_reviews.title: it was amazing and I was 100% satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I've used it about 3 months now. At first, it was amazing and I was 100% satisfied. I thought it was one of the better purchases I had made. Now the thing shuts off randomly for no reason and is basically unusable. If you go to the kindle forum here at Amazon, you'll see that thousands of others have the same issue. Amazon is good about replacement, if you fill out all of their paper work and mail them your unit, then wait for the replacement to come in. The replacement will most likely suffer the same issues as the original. This thing is a lemon. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Drewk

customer_reviews.title: This Senior says AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a first generation Kindle to this product and I am so happy with it. I am a senior and am a little intimidated by some technology. I am having no problem learning this as it is very user-friendly. Graphics are sharp and clear and I was blown away by the quality of sound on it. I cannot speak for the technical side of this product but I can speak from the user's side and in one word I would say it is AWESOME! and highly recommend, especially if you are a new user in the Tablet world.
customer_reviews.author: Gardengirl

customer_reviews.title: Special Offer "Deal" not so special
customer_reviews.text: Might as well pay any extra money for the device because the "discounted" price w/ "special offers" is like browsing the internet, every time you go to open your kindle there is an advertisement for some garbage right on your screen. The only way to remove this is to pay $15. SO, all in all its not a deal to get the kindle at the price, they just find ways to make it sound like a deal while in reality its jus as annoying as internet pop ups
customer_reviews.author: suggf

customer_reviews.title: if you get pay extra to disable the "special offers", they are annoying
customer_reviews.text: It was ok initially, definitely definitely pay the extra so that you don't get the "special offers", recent updates to this device have made it unusable by the person it was given to. My 72yo mother, ads pop up randomly when she's trying to read, when she turns it on she gets confused by all the popups, when she changes books, there are more ads (sorry Special Offers). More and more ads seem to be popping up, I've replaced it with a nook running the kindle app, that's less confusing and disruptive for her.
customer_reviews.author: Wende

customer_reviews.title: Needs help with navigation.
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to get started, because no instructions come wit the Kindle. I got the help I needed from a techniction. Then, it has this stream at the bottom, telling me the. # of hours & minutes, plus how many pages you have left to read, at the bottom of the page. Then, if you touch it accidently, at a certain place, it goes to the end or sometimes to the beginning. You have to, then, flip backward or forward, forever with your fingers. I am really not S pleased with the Fire HD, As I was with the Fire.
customer_reviews.author: The Gremlin

customer_reviews.title: Great device!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this Kindle for over 4 years now and I love it! The battery life is good, the brightness has a wide range, there a handful of color and font options for viewing books, it's easy to browse or shop for more books rightfrom the device, there are a lot of games and apps (Facebook, Netflix, Hulu, Candy Crush) that be downloaded. This device even came in handy when I was taking an online class (that didn't require Word or Excel) when I didn't want to buy a computer.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Harriman

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Warehouse only has 30 day warranty. Device died at 32.
customer_reviews.text: Bought through Amazon Warehouse as a used/very good item on April 18. On May 22 it developed a problem where it can only be used when plugged in shuts off when unplugged. I called for support and found there was nothing they could do since it only had a 30 day warranty! 32 days was all I got out of this item. Now I've got to go through the hassle of a trade in/upgrade. So frustrating. I use these for my kids homeschool & now I'll have to wait a week or more juggling kids and devices trying to keep them from falling behind.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: save to Clipboard Option is Virtual and I've lost a lot of info that i was saving. It's ALL GONE!
customer_reviews.text: I have been thrilled with my Kindle Fire HD. I have used it for everything I do instead of my home computer. But my reason for only giving it 3 stars is because it gives the option st save to clipboard. I have saved a lot of things to clipboard and was just told by customer service that "Clip board" is actually a virtual thing and that there is no way to retrieve the info that I thought was being saved! It is ALL LOST! I don't understand why that option is given when there is no clipboard?
customer_reviews.author: Deb JTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Built-in Failure
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY KINDLE FIRE!! Without fail the wireless will stop functioning properly at some point. At first it'll drop connection constantly and say it's not connected when every other device in the house connects fine. Also it'll say it's not connected when it actually is. I went through five of these and everyone had the same problem. It must be a built-in feature.
customer_reviews.author: JZ1

customer_reviews.title: Keeps breaking-very annoying.
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, however, I felt compelled to warn others. After having it for two months, one kindle would no longer charge and the other one had a frozen screen that would never shift from the offers! Amazon sends you replacements that are refurbished. One replacement will not stay turned on unless it is plugged in. Do not waste your money on this product unless you pay for the protection plan. You will get your money's worth out of the protection plan. However, it is so annoying to have to keep sending them back. I encourage you to spend the extra money and get an iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: All the around is a great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Kindle tablet, my first was the 3rd version. So since the price was right I took a chance....thus far I am very happy with it all the way around.....I'd love the next to have AC wifi connection (for us speed freaks) Ha! I'm a traveling medical profession, so this is by far a great for what I use (the actual internet, e-mail, occasionally watching a movie but I'm glad I took the chance.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Faulty equipment, crummy app store
customer_reviews.text: The kindle fire is a fine tablet, if annoyingly unable to support Google Play for some reason (it's an android tablet that won't run android apps, good job, Amazon). Although the dearth of good content is manageable, we've had two for about a year and they're starting to turn off randomly. Sometimes in the middle of a game, sometimes a few seconds after they finish their 2-3 minute boot time from the last time they died. And this is with 50%+ battery life left. Considering Amazon Prime Video runs on other, actually good devices, I recommend getting something that isn't subject to a walled garden. If they didn't constantly die, I'd probably be a lot happier.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: keeps turning off screen goes blank then must restart
customer_reviews.text: not happy, this turns off while reading email, turns off when reading a book that I bought and so we called amazon and a guy fixed over WiFi and it still turns off. we are returning it. this was to be a Christmas gift to my wife as she enjoys reading books. no joy
customer_reviews.author: B B

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother with any Fire tablet until the Amazon app store improves.
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a gift. It's just okay at best. It's a very simple tablet with no bells or whistles. The screen looks good. There is no camera. It would be far better if the Amazon app store had more to offer. Many apps I'd like just aren't available and many of the ones that are don't work as well. Access to the Google play store would solve many of these issues, but I suppose Google is Amazons competition. Amazon does many things well. This is not one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: book reading is trying to be too hi-tech. I just want to read a book.
customer_reviews.text: When I read books with this I want it to be like a book. I don't want "reading speed" and "time left to read." That is stupid. Nobody reads a book thinking about their reading speed or time left. It needs to be like a real book, relaxation and enjoyment and reading at their own pace. none of that bullcrap. Get rid of that. Nobody needs that. You make timers and counters and stuff but nobody wants that. It just needs to be like a real book. Or what's the point?
customer_reviews.author: Jase1478

customer_reviews.title: Spent ages on phone with very poor tech support asking the same questions over and over ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these and both developed faults. First time with the battery not holding charge and the second time the wifi functionality seemed to have corrupted itself and will not connect. Spent ages on phone with very poor tech support asking the same questions over and over and they said it was over a year since I received the product and I would need to buy another. The product was ordered on 13 November 2014 (I would guess it was delivered by November 17th) and today is November 20th 2015. That's a little over a year!
customer_reviews.author: Dashmartini

customer_reviews.title: Speedy Delivery!
customer_reviews.text: I must say, I'm truly impressed with the delivery of this product. I ordered it on Monday, Jan 6 and received it today!!! Unbelievable!! I was expecting it to arrive next week sometime. Glad I now have it. I've had 2 tablets and neither one of them lasted very long although those tablets were not ordered through Amazon. I love this Kindle Fire HD tablet already! The pictures, whether games, videos, movies, etc., are crystal clear and beautiful. Excellent sound as well! Features are great also!! All is going well with my new tablet right now. I hope it stays that way!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisacious

customer_reviews.title: Decent hardware severely hampered by Amazon's software.
customer_reviews.text: Goddamnit Amazon. Kindles prevent themselves from being primary use tablets because of Amazon's insistence on using the clunky proprietary interface and software rather than stock Android with Playstore. I have been so close to rooting this tablet a few times. I just want to use Gchat and play Clash of Clans, not a tall order.Chrome? Chromecast? Internet thru the Bluetooth via Foxfi? No and no, and no. Lame. Anyway, that's basically why this gets 2 stars; it would be a great tablet for the price but it's hamstrings are cut. Amazon's insistence on control takes away whatever cool factor this thing has; I just use it to read books on the plane.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Donner

customer_reviews.title: BAD INVESTMENT.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got this kindle about a year and a half ago. She has taken great care of, but it just stopped working. It will not charge or turn on. Amazon will do nothing. The 40 second reboot does not work, so they say it is unfixable. They will do nothing about it. They offered me a 'discount' on refurbished kindles, one being the exact same kindle, and they all cost MORE than my original brand new one. I am very upset, considering I don't have the money to buy a new tablet EVERY year. I will definitely be looking into other options, as a Kindle is a pretty bad investment.
customer_reviews.author: Lora Dinger

customer_reviews.title: I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Kindle HD!! No problem whatsoever setting it up. The display is clean and crisp and totally responsive. I'm not a gamer or a social media addict, except for Facebook, but it seems it would work equally well for them. I am a big reader and streaming video person and this works great on both counts. We travel quite a bit and I wanted something small to fit in my purse to pick up the occasional hotspot to catch up with family and friends back home. I can download lots of reading to take along with the 16GB. Can't say enough great things about my Kindle except why did I wait so long..for a great sale!!
customer_reviews.author: WandaG.

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to purchase warranty protection!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my Kindle Fire approximately 14 months ago. I loved it when I first purchased it. Unfortunately, after about 10 months, I had trouble with the battery. The kindle would only work when it was plugged in. I didn't purcahse additional warranty (as I expected amazon product to be quality product). Therefore, I kept using it whiel plugged in. However, I am now 14 months from purchase and the Kindle has quit completely. Even when plugged in it will now longer start. I will purchase another one (because I have spent money for apps), and I will be sure to purchase the additional warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Think twice
customer_reviews.text: Have owned since December. Was a great product. I used it last night it was fine. I keep it on a table plugged in to the charger. I have been noticing that the device and charger are becoming hot. When I used the device today the screen was cracked near the charger. The customer service, said they could help me by selling me a cheaper Kindle. I have had this for less then a year and am extremely disappointed that amazon will not stand behind their product. I guess I should consider myself lucky, because if it got hot enough to crack the screen it could have caught on fire. What a disappointment Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Since sliced bread!
customer_reviews.text: With all the technology to choose from this day and age, I put off purchasing an Kindle. What a mistake on my part. Sure, there are lots of tablets that can do the same things, but Amazon has combined them all together and made it fast and easy to do whatever it is you are doing. With the addition of Amazon Prime this is the most cost effective purchase I have made in a long time. The only complaint I have is that I am not getting anything else done since it arrived. I made the mistake of getting the 8GB and now regret not getting the larger version, but I am going to remedy that very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Zombified

customer_reviews.title: Not very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Kindle and I must admit to disappointment with the improvements over earlier models. The color is mostly irrelevant to me since I use it primarily for reading. The controls usually provided are still there but they seem less easy to find than on earlier B&W Kindle models. On top of that the first instrument I received died after 40 hours of use. The replacement is working ok so far but it seems to stall occasionally as well. Maybe I'll get used to it, but so far I find my B&W Kindle 2 for $67 much more reliable and user friendly than the fancier new ones at $137 and up.
customer_reviews.author: Allan G. Feldt..

customer_reviews.title: Wider edges style: wish Amazon still sold this
customer_reviews.text: They don't sell this model any longer. I think Amazon, you missed the boat. For men, the wider edges where larger fingers and thumbs reside, are almost a necessity. I think that other men must have this problem. Both my newer kindle and my iPad are all but impossible for my husband. But, very glad you can still buy these. Recommend if you also have larger fingers.
customer_reviews.author: myfriendbarley

customer_reviews.title: Newer generations lack features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after seeing a friend's demonstrated to me. Hers was at least a year old but had a feature this one lacks--the ability to expand the screen with a "pinch"--not sure what that's called, but this one doesn't have that feature. It's amazing that an "updated", new generation model has fewer features than the old generation. Since I have close vision problems, this is an important feature for me, and this model lacks it. So, in order to get the SAME feature as a previous HD model, I have to buy an HDX, at least $100 more.
customer_reviews.author: Joi de Vivre

customer_reviews.title: Watch video on it a lot
customer_reviews.text: The "Special Offers" isn't really all that annoying. I do take it to church with a scripture app, so sometimes the ads in the startup window aren't all that "church-worthy" but otherwise not a big deal. Every now and then I wish I'd gotten the cellular model instead of the wireless model, but not enough to switch. That being said if I upgrade or replace it, I'll stick to wireless-only. I watch video on it on my treadmill and it withstands vibration and sweat and a little bit of getting banged around pretty decently. Better than I expected. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Charles Miske

customer_reviews.title: A great device.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to use Lots of apps Great speakers Linked to prime account for easy video streaming....and shopping Great feel and size to it Excellent specs for the money Customer support can be really helpful Cons: Sound does not always play when starting an app or videos. You have to retry by exiting the app or video and starting over again. On my second device and this happens across the board. Necessity to manually start the kindle if you leave the device for too long. Even if it's fully charged you have to hold the button for 20 seconds to get it to start. Every. day. Second kindle as well to have this issue. Customer support can really hinder
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Brumley

customer_reviews.title: Hate my kindle
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be great for audiobooks and movies while traveling but I have to fight to download everything. Extremely slow, loses the connection most of the time. I have been able to download one movie I purchased. That is it. I just spent an hour trying to download a book. I have followed all the "tips" to no avail. I am usually very pleased with anything from Amazon, but I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Little L

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: I really Love the Kindle fire. The only thing I do not Love about this particular one is the new shape. I personally liked the original even though it felt a tad heavier I liked it better. Otherwise I like how you can switch profiles so if your kids want to have their own games and apps they can. Overall a great product and Amazon always has wonderful customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Monica32

customer_reviews.title: 10 Stars for Amazon's ...Customer's  love thier with Kindle Fire HD7",WiFi, 8GB
customer_reviews.text: This little convenient item is just about ready to be my full time internet booklet. I so so impressed by this marvel. Great to take along on a Dr. appointment. Such an awesome handy world of fun. I am so thrilled with my Fire Hi 7",HD Display, WiFi, 8GB Great a lovely selection of books tv shows,games or play games on your Fire it's the best purchase, I've made in awhile. The Prime customer service is wonderful, many ways to occupy some of your relaxing time. It will take you anywhere! Thanks again Amazon, I love this litttle square! Get yours today!
customer_reviews.author: luscious1

customer_reviews.title: love it.
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me because he didn't want to have to build me another bookshelf. I didn't think I'd love it so much. I struggle with technology. My grandparents are rocking their iPhones while I cling to my flip phone that only calls and texts. So when I first powered on and it automatically walked me through the set up I was pleased. Everything was packaged neatly and functioned properly. I've had it for a few months with no issues. The battery life it strong and the cord has taken some abuse without any side effect. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jcampbell

customer_reviews.title: charging port malfunctions
customer_reviews.text: Charging port gets loose. I temporarily solved it by buying a different vendor charging cord, but a few years later and the Kindle won't charge again. It is very disappointing since it functions fine, the battery is fine, I just can't use the charging port to charge the battery rendering the Kindle useless.
customer_reviews.author: crazymomof5

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME.  Love it, and great price for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (7), homeschooled, asked for a Kindle Fire (like Nana) for Christmas. I laughed at her. But then after researching I bought it, and I. AM. SO. GLAD. I. DID. It is very child friendly and I set up timelines where they can have unlimited reading, and timed videos/games. What a phenomenal product. ALSO, if you buy it on Amazon, it COMES registered to you. Before I got it, I ran through the free stuff that goes with Kindle and did the one-click purchase. Easy Peasy. When I fired up the Kindle, ALL OF THE STUFF I GOT WAS LOADED AUTOMATICALLY!!!!!!!!!! As soon as I got the wireless Internet hooked up, it was done from there. Phenomenal product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Constantly froze.  Terrible tech support.
customer_reviews.text: We were very unhappy with this model. We bought it for my toddler to use because he was always stealing our iPads. The unit constantly froze. We called support and they were fairly unhelpful. We got nothing more than them telling us to restart it when it freezes. We were told all tablets freeze, it's how computers work. Um, no. We have never had an issue with our iPads. Then when we returned it they only refunded a portion of the purchase price. We called and complained, pointed out we were within 30 days and the unit was defective. They immediately returned the rest of our money.
customer_reviews.author: Andy L.

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect to get much for your money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these as gifts for my mother and grandmother last year. My grandmother's mysteriously crashed 5 days out of the warranty. I called and spoke with tech support on her behalf and after determining the device was completely unusable, they refused to replace it or refund it and offered a "refurbished" replacement for almost the same price as what I payed for a new one. I really like Amazon and their products but this experience has turned me off to their digital products. I am switching to a different brand and advising all of my friends and family to do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Salty

customer_reviews.title: This Is Our 2nd Kindle Fire HD 7"
customer_reviews.text: Our first Kindle Fire HD 7" froze up and died after only 4 months. Amazon customer service went above and beyond via phone and internet to help solve the problem. We finally had to wave the white flag and surrender. And of course this happened on a Friday. But thanks to the amazing service of Amazon, we had a new one by the following Tuesday. My sons play games on it every day and I like to read with it at night. Love the black page/white font. We really like our Kindle Fire HD 7" and are considering purchasing another one before the end of the year. And hats off to the spectacular folks who work in Amazon customer service!
customer_reviews.author: MountainGoat

customer_reviews.title: Battery
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Kindle Fire HD 7" Wi-Fi, 8 GB a little over a year ago. Within 6-8 months, I noticed the battery wasn't lasting more than an hour or so of my grandchildren playing app-games on it. Watching a movie drained it before the movie ended. Now, it is good for about 30 minutes before the battery runs out. And I turn wi-fi off when not being used, so that's not the drain on the battery. It would probably go a little longer with just reading, but I didn't buy it for "just reading"--my original Kindle works fine for that. Huge disappointment. Will not be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: B.K.

customer_reviews.title: Prefer the iPad
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife, but she's not in to technology, so I spent a lot of time trying to find out how to get it to do the same thngs my iPad would do. Fimally gave up and bought her an iPad and we've been happy ever since. One thing--I thought I was getting a screen that would make it easy to read in full sunlight. That turned out not to be the case so it was a waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Great option for rear seat entertainment system alternative!
customer_reviews.text: We have two, one for a 7 year old and a 3 year old. Primary use is for our longish commute each day and the kids love them. Great battery life as well and the app management apps you can use to restrict what your kids can do - and the resulting frustration - are great. The kid-control apps are of course available for all Android tablets though. The hardware is sturdy, easily held by the kids. I'd buy again. Pair these with an Airstash and you have an RSE that really does work well. Two 1000+ mile road trips this summer and the kids were happy and the Airstash never had an issue. Everyone was very happy!
customer_reviews.author: B. Doctor

customer_reviews.title: If you want to spend most of you time on Youtube, don't buy, else a good product.
customer_reviews.text: The Kindle Fire HD is a great tablet except for the fact sit does not have Adobe Flash installed and unable to see YOUTUBE videos. Without the ability to see youtube and other videos I have which require Adobe flash it is almost useless for me. I have mentioned this to several others which were going to buy one and have changed their minds. I gave this one away and ordered a Samsung for a few bucks more with a lot move useable things. I am aware there are ways to install Adobe flash, but right now I just want some thing which works.
customer_reviews.author: Gil

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY IF YOU WANT A "TABLET"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Kindle to read books and also as a tablet to do Facebook, search the web, etc. As the years have gone by, Amazon drastically reduced the tablet capabilities It won't update Facebook, I think my version is from more than 2 years ago. Called CS and was told "We're aware of the problem. We're working on it. Sorry for the inconvenience." Really? TWO YEARS!? I if you want to read, kindle is excellent. If you want multipurpose, buy the cheap black and white and get a cheap tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Tablet, Does Everything But Fly Around The Room
customer_reviews.text: A fine device, even better than the last. Amazon never fails to do the right thing. Got this as a replacement for my previous Fire HD, which somehow acquired a cracked screen. The previous Kindle had a front facing camera, which I never used and 32 gig of memory. This one seems faster and responds better to touch gestures than the last one, all in all I believe that it is a better device. My first Kindle e reader was a keyboard with 3g and wi-fi, but seemed fragile. Each succeeding device has been better than the last, and Amazon's service remains stellar (hence the five stars...badaboom). Looking forward to my next Amazon device, a new Fire Phone! Can't wait...
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rene Rogerson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great little tablet! Perfect for watching movies, playing games, and reading books. Although it's not as fast or as powerful as the HDX, for the price it's VERY hard to beat. It's powerful enough to watch movies in HD and the response of the interface is very smooth. One note though, it does sometimes get warm around the edges if you're doing some processor intensive applications with the brightness up all the way. This causes the battery to drain faster than expected. Although this occurs sometimes, it's no different from other tablets I've experiences. Overall, it's a great tablet at a great price. If you really want speed, upgrade to the HDX.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Mainly for Music
customer_reviews.text: It's best use is for playing music. You can play games and use your other applications ONLY if you have Internet access so Bezos can load it with advertisements. If you try to play with no connectivity, you will get a message telling you to download the application again.
customer_reviews.author: Communer

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Fire HD 7" Rocks
customer_reviews.text: Love my Kindle. I use it for Internet searching, reading, watching Prime movies, and music. With the ability to download music, books, and movies I don't need Wi-Fi to use on the bus or when traveling. Connected to Wi-Fi easily and the connection is stable. Recommend for ease in transporting when commuting and when downloading music or a book when an Internet connection is not available. Oh, yes, then there is moving other .pdf books from the PC to Kindle. I do not have children though I can see the value of having time limits on use as well as security. Lots of ways to use Kindle Fire HD and very glad I purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: NWNative

customer_reviews.title: Very good replacement Kindle
customer_reviews.text: Very good replacement for my 2nd Kindle but I was disappointed that it did not have a camera. It was also smaller than my 2nd Kindle so the cover I had for it will not fit and I had to buy a new one. Not pleased about that. Since I had to pay a fee for the refurbished replacement it seems that it should have been the same as the original one that I HAD TO RETURN. Overall I am pleased with the refurbished replacement but for the couple of issues cited above. Amazon is very easy to work with, their customer service is awesome and I will certainly keep working with them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: I love the kindle but a few problems.
customer_reviews.text: This kindle hasn't a camera o Others do other 3rd geneneration do!! With cover I had to buy does not shut off when I close and turn on when I open where others do. Disappointing. Power cord it came with did not work so I have to use my phone cord. Now the good stuff. Picture and sound beautiful. If every everything else was fine I would be very happy. Daughter has same kindle and has camera cord is fine we had to buy our own Cover but hers works. Bummer for me. All in all I do still love a kindle. I just so wish mine worked right and had camera!!,!
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Main Purpose
customer_reviews.text: PROS A good quality media consumer device that works well within 2'. Screen size limits the distance. Reading a book and watching a movie/video works very well, as does listing to a pre-recorded audiobook. Very good screen. It's solid and the UI is not difficult to learn. (This is my first Kindle). CONS The reading feature is difficult to listen to for more than a few minutes ... sounds to me closer to the old HERO robot or a Speak & Spell. (For the youth, look them up on Wikipedia). ----- The browser is OK. Have not tried email ... my phone is always with me when the Kindle is with me, so I use it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thomsen

customer_reviews.title: Another great Amazon Product
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 3 year old daughter and we're all very happy with it. I have a paperwhite, and it's much better in the sunlight, but this is WAY better than my iPad in the sun. I love that we can download movies right to the kindle, it's really convenient when we're out and don't have access to wifi. I also love the free time - it's really nice for us to manage our daughter's usage while still giving her freedom. My only complaint is that the sound doesn't always work and sometimes we can't get it to turn on. It doesn't happen a lot, but enough for me to take away one star.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Such a wonderful value!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a KF HD and I have a Paperwhite. We wanted to get a KF HD for my 10 year old daughter for books and games. She loves it! The price of this device is a steal compared to all other tablets, both Apple and Android. I couldn't be more thrilled with this purchase. She quickly loaded it up with about forty FREE apps and has already read two complete books since school ended. That's two more books than she read all last summer! I bought the FreeTime kid-proof case, which I wouldn't have dreamed of NOT getting for a kid. I'm probably going to get one for her six year old sister for christmas!
customer_reviews.author: E. Donald

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for my old Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I've looked at dozens of tablets, And really none compare to the iPad. But for what I use a tablet for, at least these days, this is clearly one of the best and an absolute bargain. It has worked flawlessly for me since I bought it. Made my life a little easier if I want to take a break from reading and surf, hit facebook, or shop. For the price point of a woeful android tablet, this thing is spectacular. It's not a real full function tablet, and it's tethered to Amazon, but so what? I find myself buying through amazon more and more. So for what I needed, it's the best thing going.
customer_reviews.author: Atticus Finch

customer_reviews.title: For More Experienced Users
customer_reviews.text: Though I have great respect for Amazon and their products, I had to say that I did not like this Kindle Fire. First off, it was VERY HARD to set up. For someone like me, who has never had a tablet before, it was a nightmare to try and get everything how it was supposed to be for connection. In addition, which this was not Amazon's fault, 7" was just too small for me to do the things I wanted to do with it. After less than a week, I returned it and Amazon gave me a full refund. I would have liked to buy the bigger version, but it was out of my price range.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Tink

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Fire HD (2013 Version)
customer_reviews.text: As far as Kindle tablets go, how can you beat them? So, I'll review my tablet (2012 model) vs. this one (2013 model). Pros: The 2013 comes with a 5W charger (2012 didn't come with a wall charger - and USB charging sucks). Power and volume buttons larger and more clearly labeled. Cons: The 2013 model does not have a mini-HDMI port! 2012 did, and cost whopping $2 for a cable that hooked the Kindle to the TV. 2013 model requires a certain TV, OR a $60 conversion box.... Major feature loss for 2013 Model IMO. Other than that, they are about the same.
customer_reviews.author: GWBuffalo

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for yourself or anyone
customer_reviews.text: This was a great pick up for under $100 for our kid's Christmas gift. We subscribed to Kindle free time as it is perfect for guiding our kids tablet use. The unit itself is durable and battery life is decent. The buttons on the back are easy for her to reach and utilize. Set up time was quick and has a decent download speed. Picture quality is great and the overall layout of the interface is easy to navigate. The only con I can think of is just the battery life as it is only used for 1 hour a day and seems it needs to be changed every other day.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Zelski

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good Kindle/Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much what I expected; a nice compromise between a Kindle and a high-end Tablet. One of the things I've always liked about my previous Kindles is the INK; one of the thinks I disliked was the lack of color (making it less than desirable for periodicals). The Fire display sacrifices the totally awesome beach-read capability of the black-and-white Kindle for a vivid color display (which washes out quite a bit in direct sunlight) plus the capabilities of a good, Wi-Fi-only, Android (sorta) tablet. Not a bad compromise, especially considering the also-totally-awesome Kindle book store. I'm still getting familiar with Android, but the Fire definitely lives up to my expectiations; maybe more.
customer_reviews.author: PhxRick

customer_reviews.title: Original vs New Kindle Fire
customer_reviews.text: I have one of the first Kindle Fires sold by Amazon in November, 2111. I am perfectly happy with it but I though the battery was beginning to give out. I ordered a new Kindle Fire HD display with 16GB memory. I discovered that it was a game I had downloaded that used up my battery so fast as the new Kindle Fire's battery lost power just as fast. Frankly, I like my old Kindle Fire more than the new one. I prefer the original display of apps and the shape is easier to hold. I do like the volume control on the outside of the new one. The HD display seems no different than the original one.
customer_reviews.author: John Ritzema

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift young grandson. A BIG hit for him. He uses it daily. His Dad, a tech administrator, wasn't keen on his young son having electronic devices, but his Mom wanted him to have the Kindle. After Dad researched the Kindle's features, he agreed to let him have it. We all like the parental control features. It has helped grandson become aware of time because he is only allowed to access the Kindle for a set amount of time. I highly recommend the Kindle Fire HD with additional purchase of the I-Blason ArmorBox for protection against dropping.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Love this model except...
customer_reviews.text: I am VERY pleased with the device itself. I have two problems with functionality: for some reason, links to Face Book pages I receive in my Y-mail will not connect with Face Book. If I use the built-in email it flashes and mutters and eventually connects. Mostly. The huge complaint ( and, yes, "they're working on it") is the Flash incompatibility. This even affects some online shopping sites, not just video. I REALLY find this a deficiency. Let's work together, can we? Otherwise, I'm huge Kindle fan, use it constantly, recommend it to everyone, and buy in bulk for charity. Great resolution, streams Netflix well, does everything I want in a small package.
customer_reviews.author: Calypsoreid

customer_reviews.title: Great consumer tablet at a great price
customer_reviews.text: The new kindle HD 7" is a great tablet for consumption. You can browse the web, facebook, read, and watch videos. It does lack a user and world facing camera, so don't plan on taking pictures or Skyping with it. It has very good build quality and super long battery capacity. I highly recommend the "Moko slim folding case" to go with it -- the case provides protection and has several convenience features that will help you get the most out of your Kindle. My only real complaint is that Amazon has limited Apps available. Don't expect to have the same accessibility as the Google Play store.
customer_reviews.author: Blue_Flamingo

customer_reviews.title: I've always like it for reading and now that I have prime
customer_reviews.text: I've had my kindle for a couple years now. I've always like it for reading and now that I have prime, I like it for watching instant videos. As far as apps, it's no iPad. Pinterest and Facebook both leave something to be desired but it's not like they're unusable. Games are also limited. This is all coming from an iPhone/iPad user so take from that what you will. Overall I like it. I even bought one for my boyfriend who games so he can look things up online while he plays without exiting the game he's playing. He used it a lot at first but now, not as much. He is not a smartphone or tablet user otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: 1 Issue
customer_reviews.text: I would give my new Kindle Fire HD 5 stars, except for the fact that I can't seem to get the time changed on it. I chatted with customer service on 10/9 and she could not help me, so she said she'd "need to forward the details to the technical team and get back to me within 1-2 business days with the resolution." Welp, it's now 10/24 and I have sent 2 more communications, with no resolution. I deserve better customer service, especially since I order so much stuff from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: W. Bellert

customer_reviews.title: My fourth kindle
customer_reviews.text: For one reason or another, I am on my fourth kindle. I love my kindle and the new HD is very nice. I was VERY disappointed to find out that the On - Off button was placed underneath the kindle. Can't imagine why anyone thought this was a good idea!!! I would think that most people have their kindle in a cover. I have to take the kindle OUT of the cover every time I turn it on and off or charge it. Very annoying. If I could figure out how to complain to Amazon, I would. But trying to contact them is like pulling teeth. This change in placement of the on/off button is definitely NOT an improvement!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this several years ago and should have sent it back day two. The battery dies in it even when not in use. The only way to use it is having it plugged in to charging port at all times, which means you can't ever take it away from an electrical outlet. Don't buy
customer_reviews.author: DYIer Indy

customer_reviews.title: not great just a marketing vehicle for amazon...not consumer friendly
customer_reviews.text: its linked to my account and is a present for my 7 year old...didn't know he'd have full access to buy whatever now I have to figure out how to lock it out of my account. no camera. rear facing speakers sound good but are muffled easily. too many ads this thing should be free as its just a marketing vehicle for amazon. not very intuitive to sync videos and music currently owned...always sends me back to the kindle store to buy music. also doesn't place my videos well when you try to fast forward sound track goes away. piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: M N M

customer_reviews.title: light weight and big enough for him to read easily. The really great thing though is that you ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who reads a lot, especially during the winter. It's very convenient, light weight and big enough for him to read easily. The really great thing though is that you don't have to go to the bookstore to buy a new book or order it on line and wait for it to be delivered, You just pay for it (and the prices are usually pretty good), download it and start reading.
customer_reviews.author: W. Toro

customer_reviews.title: New Kindle Fire HD wonderful but recommend waiting for new accessories to become available.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the new Kindle Fire HD to replace a Kindle Fire birthday gift that is presumed to be stolen. I do not think the price can be beaten for features available on the unit. The battery does seem to last longer then the 10 hours listed in the specifications data. The picture is great. I am hoping that more protective case (sleeve) selections will become available eventually; I was not satisfied with what was available with the new models and felt they were excessively expensive for what is offered. I also was very dissatisfied with the screen protector that was purchased.
customer_reviews.author: William C.

customer_reviews.title: ... is one of 2 kindles I own and I like my 7 best
customer_reviews.text: This is one of 2 kindles I own and I like my 7 best. Its just the right size for reading or watching movies by myself. The screen has a nice sharp colorful picture which makes using it enjoyable. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Although while it worked it worked we loved it. I am very disappointed that the warranty ...
customer_reviews.text: Although while it worked it worked we loved it. I am very disappointed that the warranty is only for a year and a year and one week after I bought this for my son we ended up with a black screen and were unable to get the issue resolved and were offered a "deal" on a new one. I passed... if they don't last more than a week after the warranty without any options to fix it I will go with a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY KINDLE FIRE HD
customer_reviews.text: I PREVIOUSLY HAD RECEIVED A KINDLE FIRE (1ST EDITION) FOR MY BIRTHDAY AND LOVED IT BUT IT WOULD NOT CHARGE PROPERLY SO IT WENT BACK FOR A REPLACEMENT AND THE REPLACEMENT HAD A PROBLEM WITH FREEZING SO IT WENT BACK FOR ANOTHER REPLACEMENT. WELL I GAVE UP WHEN THE THIRD ONE HAD A PROBLEM AND GAVE UP. WENT WITHOUT ANYTHING FOR A COUPLE OF YEARS BECAUSE I STARTED TO THINK THAT I WAS THE PROBLEM . HOWEVER, I RECENTLY DECIDED TO ORDER THE KINDLE FIRE HD 7" AND, SO FAR SO GOOD, I LOVE IT. COLOR GREAT, RECEPTION OF TV SHOWS, ETC FANTASTIC!!!! i AM REALLY ENJOYING THIS ONE.
customer_reviews.author: DAWDAW

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier. Touch screen works like a charm, battery life is better than I was hoping for, and the software is very intuitive. The screen resolution is great. Only downside is the location of the power button. In landscape position I am frequently hitting it accidentally. Saving grace is the attempt at idiot proofing, you are given a chance to back out before it actually powers down. All in all, for the price it's a great little reader/tablet. Don't worry about the special offers. They pop up when you turn the power on and disappear when you unlock the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but LACKS one main feature.
customer_reviews.text: I choose this rating because honestly, I like it and my mother likes it as she's the one I bought it for.What we dislike which is the ONLY down fall and it's the fact it had no camera. I had my eye on this product for months and had no clue that wasn't included.I even checked GSMArena but I guess that part was overlooked. All the Kindle Fires have except this "new kindle fire HD" Not happy on that and if I new at first I would arrange some exchange and pay the difference for 8" or so. We recommend that this product be remodelled and have the camera feature.We believe that completes the product.
customer_reviews.author: Natty Nats

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the Kindle Unhappy with the service policy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Kindle just before the holiday. Unfortunately for me I experienced a problem with it. Amazon was quick to replace and replace it they did. Unfortunately even though I bought the extended service plan I failed to read the fine print that states that should there be a problem or defect with your Kindle Amazon reserves the right to replace it with a remanufactured unit. Hardly what I would call fair. I feel that if I had wanted a remanufactured Kindle I would have bought one. I guess the old axiom is still very true. LET THE BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffr3y Hamelin

customer_reviews.title: Love these - paid to remove the ads
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as Christmas presents for my 4 and 5 year old daughters. Much better options than the kids tablets out there. Loads of free apps and games vs. the proprietary tablets prices. They can stream netflix also, a big plus, and I can load music for them. Paid to get the 'special offers' removed. Didn't realize the ads would be EVERYWHERE. very annoying for a child to have to navigate around. Didn't want that hassle of strange or inappropriate ads coming up. Worth it to get rid of them. We now have 3 Kindle Fires in the house. Great product. Will probably end up with more.
customer_reviews.author: CJS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Kindle Fire for my daughter about a year ago, and we've been very happy with the performance of every aspect of this device. My daughter uses this almost everyday for playing games like Minecraft, and watching Youtube videos. It has very good performance and is user friendly. Also, the battery is still going strong and still charges without any problems. Our experience with this device is very positive, and we would have no problems with getting another. I highly recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Atlas

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with New Yorker App for print subscribers
customer_reviews.text: I used my old first gen kindle to read the New Yorker, which we subscribe to in the print version. The app just lets you log in and read the Kindle version if you already subscribe to print. BUT I just upgraded to the Fire HD, and after spending a frustrating hour chatting with Amazon customer service, discovered that the app isn't compatible with the HD. You can pay for a $60 digital version, but you can't just log in if you already subscribe. This is probably like 15% of what I use my Kindle for! Now what do I do? Take both of them on vacation? So dumb.
customer_reviews.author: Huntington

customer_reviews.title: YOU CAN'T GO WRONG WITH THIS KINDLE / PRICE COMBO
customer_reviews.text: Amazon hit the mark with this Kindle. I had one of the old ones that cost $200 and this one is a lot better for $139. The screen is large and it has an abundance of features that make it super easy to use. One thing I really enjoy is I have a pool table and practice a lot. I have downloaded several training manuals and I take the Kindle with me and it is so easy to set this by the table and read the manuals compared to a book which has to be propped open etc. Very Pleased With This Kindle. I also recommend an anti-glare screen cover.
customer_reviews.author: housewifeman

customer_reviews.title: Great for what I need it for
customer_reviews.text: I wanted just a basic kindle, but I also wanted color and touch screen capabilities. When the Kindle Fire HD 7" went on sale I knew I couldn't pass it up. Overall, it is a great reader. I don't use it for anything else, but reading in really nice and I love the battery life. It's much longer than what I would get through my kindle app on my ipad. The only thing I don't like about the Kindle fire HD 7" is you can't organize your books unless you purchase an app. And although Amazon game me welcoming coins for my kindle purchase, the apps are not very good for organization.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Reader

customer_reviews.title: A Great Deal For the Money!!!
customer_reviews.text: A great product that delivers on performance, versatility and reliability. Amazon delivers on tons of free books with a search engine that will fine a plethora of subjects and reading material for all ages. The only draw back is for thrid party apps in which the device is not user friendly towards. However, this can be overcome by downloading "1 mobile" and a "file manager" program. The book library program works like a champ, and the screen is crystal clear for reading, rich in color and detail for games and movies; and the audio sound for music and games are above average for such a small device. This product has my recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: TonyII

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I've resisted buying one of these for years- thought I'd miss books- I received one as a Christmas gift and really love it. I find that the it is a lot less strenuous on my eyes reading for long periods of time. The first book I read on Kindle was over eight hundred pages long and I finished it in four days. I like the idea that it is compact enough to carry around and if I find myself waiting someplace, or on a train, etc., I can pull it out and pass the time reading. Also, if you travel, you can have several books loaded and waiting for you. Charge lasts a long time. I've found no downside yet.
customer_reviews.author: NY Carol

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed that this kindle completely died just 2 months past the 1 yr warranty - customer support could do nothing to help revive it and offered just a measly discount on buying a new kindle (just to have it die in a year?!?) Also, kids disappointed that apps they wanted to get weren't available on Kindle (like the hugely popular clash of clans - had to google scripts to run to get updates too).
customer_reviews.author: Phia3512

customer_reviews.title: It is a great tablet for a Kindle
customer_reviews.text: This is not anything to be excited over. It is a great tablet for a Kindle, don't get me wrong. I just don't like that you have to get the apps through Amazon, and that some apps aren't available on Amazon yet. Like the Facebook messaging app, or Instagram. There is no camera where you can take pictures either. Other than that, I love shopping on Amazon with the tablet, and watching my videos. It's also great for reading, of course. I wish I could also download Google Chrome on it instead of using the current internet browser. Over all, it is better than using my crappy smart phone and it has improved my smartphone's battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S

customer_reviews.title: Glad I went up a couple of notches
customer_reviews.text: I do love it but was unhappy that my passwords did not carry over from my other Kindle - I had to do a lot of work at first getting back to playing WWF and a few other things but once I got used to it I was very happy with it. It works like a charm. My only complaint would be that it is harder to use the app page - probably because I was so used to the other Kindle app page and I find this one confusing; however, I am getting used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Celso Girl

customer_reviews.title: Fulfilled Great Expectations and more!
customer_reviews.text: I have two birthdays at the same month, we bought the Fire HDX 7" and this one, the quality and benefits are the same, Amazon Prime is a most with this device, but I do not complain, is cheaper than Netflix and gives me even more, unlimited music with Amazon Cloud, Second day shipping Free with Prime approved articles, plus my kids install many apps as they like in their Kid's Free Time environments, that only allows them see content suitable for their age. Down side... only 8 Gb, I forgot to warn my wife when she did the purchase to make sure was higher that 8Gb... So far hasn't have any Storage problem.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Vila

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded My Older Model
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this Kindle a little more than my previous one. The power button is in a better place, and there are external volume control buttons that weren't on my older Kindle Fire. I don't notice all that much difference in the HD screen because I mainly use it for reading and FaceBook. I like the placement of the external speakers better than the older one. They sound better too. This model was cheaper than my previous Kindle Fire because it contains adds on the home screen. I didn't realize that the advertisements were responsible for the discount at first, but for $50 off, I can deal with the advertisements. I'm very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Charla

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Fire HD...
customer_reviews.text: Well, to start off, to preempt this I researched this tablet before buying and decided to list som features others might be interested in. No camera A bit heavy compared to my Samsung 2 10.1 Not expandable so buy the gigs that you need. affordable and a great deal at 140 for this. actually bought this for my daughter for Christmas so she could use it as a reader and stream movies - and actually use my Prime services that I don't use very often. i.e. streaming, books, screen to smart TV. I will update later, if and when I get to play with the device.
customer_reviews.author: Batabling

product_meta.title: Kindle Fire HD 7", HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB - Includes Special Offers (Previous Generation - 3rd)
feature_bullets: 1280x800 high definition LCD display with over one million pixels
Ultra-fast web browsing over built-in Wi-Fi
Robust e-mail and calendar support for Gmail, Outlook, and more
